content: infinity scarf & matching hat uk pattern this is a quick and easy pattern to make a really lovely infinity scarf with a matching hat the pattern size is aimed at teens & adults but there are options at the end to create a smaller hat if you wish you can use any colour combination you like but i have included my colour recommendations at the end you will need 5 00mm & 4 50mm crochet hooks styelcraft special dk yarn recommended colours - dark brown mocha duck egg pistachio & stone scissors darning needle stitches used chain chain double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet front post treble_crochet fptr back post treble crochet bptr slip_stitch slip_stitch notes at the end of this document you will find 1 recommended colour sequences there are no notifications when to change colour in the pattern itself 2 tips on how to join a new colour 3 tips on how to create a neat join at the end of a round 4 recommendations on how to create the hat in different sizes if you want a smaller or larger scarf just change the number of chains worked at the beginning but make sure your initial chain is an even number and also you can change hook size if you feel you are not getting the right fit 1 pattern scarf gauge a 10cm x 10cm square on the scarf is approx 17 stitches across & 13 row high use your 5 00mm hook and dark brown yarn to begin see table at end of document for recommended colour sequence chain 250 then slip_stitch to the 1st chain to create a huge loop please make sure your chain isn t twisted then chain 1 1 work 1dc into each chain around make sure you work a double_crochet into the very first chain 250dc join with a slip_stitch to the 1st double_crochet chain 1 2 work 1 treble_crochet into each stitch around slip_stitch to join chain 1 see notes at end for tips on joining a new colour 3 work 1fptr around the first stitch then 1tr into the second stitch then 1fptr around the next stitch and 1tr into the following stitch repeat around slip_stitch to join chain 1 then turn your work turning after each round from this point onwards keeps the scarf from curling up a tip for knowing where to put your stitches the fptr always go around the stitches that look more visible such as these as you add more rounds you should see a nice waffle type pattern forming 2 4 each round from now on is the same always start with a fptr and end with a treble_crochet so it goes fptr treble_crochet fptr treble_crochet repeat around slip_stitch to join chain 1 turn 5 20 repeat round 4 remember to turn at the end of each round 21 1tr into each stitch around slip_stitch to join chain 1 turn 22 1dc into each stitch around slip_stitch to join fasten_off edging use 4
